results.title: On time
results.creator_credit: Department of the Interior, Eric Thompson and Victorian Railways
results.brief_description: More than 100,000 train passengers pass through the gates at Flinders Street Station, Melbourne each day. Control of passenger and freight trains in and out of the station on time is a masterpiece of precision planning.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Department of the Interior, Eric Thompson and Victorian Railways
results.description: More than 100,000 train passengers pass through the gates at Flinders Street Station, Melbourne each day. Control of passenger and freight trains in and out of the station on time is a masterpiece of precision planning.
description_for_label: More than 100,000 train passengers pass through the gates at Flinders Street Station, Melbourne each day. Control of passenger and freight trains in and out of the station on time is a masterpiece of precision planning.

results.title: Natural Glass
results.creator_credit: New Zealand National Film Unit, Derek Wright and John King
results.brief_description: Looks at a one-man revival of “natural” glass-making in New Zealand, contrasting the delicacies of glass making by one man with his normal job as a worker in a natural gas field.
results.creator_credit_for_label: New Zealand National Film Unit, Derek Wright and John King
results.description: Looks at a one-man revival of “natural” glass-making in New Zealand, contrasting the delicacies of glass making by one man with his normal job as a worker in a natural gas field.
description_for_label: Looks at a one-man revival of “natural” glass-making in New Zealand, contrasting the delicacies of glass making by one man with his normal job as a worker in a natural gas field.

results.title: [George Malins Home Movies: Reel 31]
results.brief_description:
George William Malins (1910–2007) was an amateur filmmaker who made home movies in Australia and overseas from the 1940s to 1970s. According to his daughter, George was ‘optimistic, happy and enthusiastic’, an outlook reflected in his films which are a history of home life and a love of travel.

George came to Australia from England as a young man by way of the merchant navy, after having seen South America and some of Asia. He met his future wife Sybil, who was impressed by George’s world travels and his dreams for the future.

The family lived in the Melbourne suburb of North Balwyn, spending their summers camping at Wye River on the Victorian coast often with extended family and friends.

George and Sybil must have shared a sense of adventure as they eventually sold the family home and sailed on the ‘SS Orontes’ to England, travelling around Britain for two years.

The George Malins Home Movie Collection was donated to ACMI by the creator’s daughter, Ruth Hargrave. The films were made on 16mm film.

This short film shows the family swimming and boating.

Selected highlghts list:
00:00:02:00 family members swimming in the shallows of a river among logs
00:00:50:00 boats moored in a sheltered spot including the ‘Shenandoah’ which the family is boarding

results.title: [George Malins Home Movies: Reel 29]
results.brief_description:
George William Malins (1910–2007) was an amateur filmmaker who made home movies in Australia and overseas from the 1940s to 1970s. According to his daughter, George was ‘optimistic, happy and enthusiastic’, an outlook reflected in his films which are a history of home life and a love of travel.

George came to Australia from England as a young man by way of the merchant navy, after having seen South America and some of Asia. He met his future wife Sybil, who was impressed by George’s world travels and his dreams for the future.

The family lived in the Melbourne suburb of North Balwyn, spending their summers camping at Wye River on the Victorian coast often with extended family and friends.

George and Sybil must have shared a sense of adventure as they eventually sold the family home and sailed on the ‘SS Orontes’ to England, travelling around Britain for two years.

The George Malins Home Movie Collection was donated to ACMI by the creator’s daughter, Ruth Hargrave. The films were made on 16mm film.

A selection of family moments, including the departure of an Ansett-ANA plane, possibly at Essendon Airport, and a visit to what may be the Bulleen Pony Club.

Selected highlights list:
00:00:02:00 people boarding an Ansett-ANA plane, model V832 Deluxe, followed by its departure across the tarmac
00:00:49:00 family members in the countryside, probably the Bulleen Pony Club, observing two horses in a field, a mare and a foal
00:01:25:00 man and boy feed horse over the fence
00:01:42:00 a toddler dressed in a white pleated skirt and pale pink cardigan playing on front porch of a brick house

results.title: [George Malins Home Movies: Reel 28]
results.brief_description:

The George Malins Home Movie Collection was donated to ACMI by the creator’s daughter, Ruth Hargrave. The films were made on 16mm film.

This film contains scenes from the Royal Melbourne Show and a glimpse of two of the younger members of the family.

Selected highlights list:
00:00:02:00 harness racing track
00:00:05:00 carnival rides
00:00:17:00 Peters brand and Sennets brand ice cream stands among the carnival rides crowds
00:00:35:00 Four and Twenty Pies advertisements on the backs of seats on the Ferris wheel
00:00:35:00 cattle being led in the grand parade
00:01:45:00 draught horses in the parade
00:02:14:00 the two young daughters of the family pose for the camera on their way to or from school

Very short film comprised of title card and a sign with blank section in between.

Selected highlights list:
00:00:02:00 title card reads ‘The Queen’ followed by blank section of film
00:00:10:00 sign on wall reads ‘Janet + Peter only 6 days’ with countdown from 6 to 1 crossed out, presumably on the day of daughter Janet’s wedding

The George Malins Home Movie Collection was donated to ACMI by the creator’s daughter, Ruth Hargrave. The films were made on 16mm film.

This film captures two cake cuttings at two occasions. One is the 21st birthday party for a young woman in the family and the other her engagement celebration.

Selected highlights list:
00:00:02:00 happy guests surround a very happy and smiling young woman ass cuts a decorated party cake
00:00:49:00 the young woman and her young man kiss, hug and smile in among the guests and then turn to the camera to show off her engagement ring
00:01:13:00 another cake cutting at another occasion with the same couple
00:01:49:00 couples dancing

This film features vintage cars departing on a Veteran Car Rally that took place between London and Brighton, with models including Clément-Bayard, Fiat and Métallurgique cars from the 1900s and 1910s.

Selected highlights list:
00:00:02:00 two men working on a Clément-Bayard car with burgundy leather interior
00:00:16:00 two men driving a cream-coloured Fiat car
00:00:52:00 close up of the front of a red and black Métallurgique model
00:01:26:00 the departure of a green 1912 Rover
00:01:52:00 two men in an open red 1905 Itala, with cover over their legs
00:03:35:00 a man and woman in a red 1916 Ford T

description_for_label:
George William Malins (1910–2007) was an amateur filmmaker who made home movies in Australia and overseas from the 1940s to 1970s. According to his daughter, George was ‘optimistic, happy and enthusiastic’, an outlook reflected in his films which are a history of home life and a love of travel.

George came to Australia from England as a young man by way of the merchant navy, after having seen South America and some of Asia. He met his future wife Sybil, who was impressed by George’s world travels and his dreams for the future.

The family lived in the Melbourne suburb of North Balwyn, spending their summers camping at Wye River on the Victorian coast often with extended family and friends.

George and Sybil must have shared a sense of adventure as they eventually sold the family home and sailed on the ‘SS Orontes’ to England, travelling around Britain for two years.

The George Malins Home Movie Collection was donated to ACMI by the creator’s daughter, Ruth Hargrave. The films were made on 16mm film.

This film features vintage cars departing on a Veteran Car Rally that took place between London and Brighton, with models including Clément-Bayard, Fiat and Métallurgique cars from the 1900s and 1910s.

Selected highlights list:
00:00:02:00 two men working on a Clément-Bayard car with burgundy leather interior
00:00:16:00 two men driving a cream-coloured Fiat car
00:00:52:00 close up of the front of a red and black Métallurgique model
00:01:26:00 the departure of a green 1912 Rover
00:01:52:00 two men in an open red 1905 Itala, with cover over their legs
00:03:35:00 a man and woman in a red 1916 Ford T

results.title: [George Malins Home Movies: Reel 23]
results.brief_description:
George William Malins (1910–2007) was an amateur filmmaker who made home movies in Australia and overseas from the 1940s to 1970s. According to his daughter, George was ‘optimistic, happy and enthusiastic’, an outlook reflected in his films which are a history of home life and a love of travel.

George came to Australia from England as a young man by way of the merchant navy, after having seen South America and some of Asia. He met his future wife Sybil, who was impressed by George’s world travels and his dreams for the future.

The family lived in the Melbourne suburb of North Balwyn, spending their summers camping at Wye River on the Victorian coast often with extended family and friends.

George and Sybil must have shared a sense of adventure as they eventually sold the family home and sailed on the ‘SS Orontes’ to England, travelling around Britain for two years.

The George Malins Home Movie Collection was donated to ACMI by the creator’s daughter, Ruth Hargrave. The films were made on 16mm film.

A short black and white film that is mainly comprised of a group of people feeding the pigeons in Trafalgar Square, London.

Selected highlights list:
00:00:02:00 two women in fur coats beside a 1940s style car in front of a large country house
00:00:25:00 a group of people at Trafalgar Square, London, feeding the pigeons

results.title: [George Malins Home Movies: Reel 22]
results.brief_description:
George William Malins (1910–2007) was an amateur filmmaker who made home movies in Australia and overseas from the 1940s to 1970s. According to his daughter, George was ‘optimistic, happy and enthusiastic’, an outlook reflected in his films which are a history of home life and a love of travel.

George came to Australia from England as a young man by way of the merchant navy, after having seen South America and some of Asia. He met his future wife Sybil, who was impressed by George’s world travels and his dreams for the future.

The family lived in the Melbourne suburb of North Balwyn, spending their summers camping at Wye River on the Victorian coast often with extended family and friends.

George and Sybil must have shared a sense of adventure as they eventually sold the family home and sailed on the ‘SS Orontes’ to England, travelling around Britain for two years.

The George Malins Home Movie Collection was donated to ACMI by the creator’s daughter, Ruth Hargrave. The films were made on 16mm film.

This short film captures the visit of a friend after her arrival on a TAA (Trans Australian Airlines) airplane. The host and visitor have some fun with the camera, posing and pretending to run away from the family home.

Selected highlights list:
00:00:03:00 an airplane taxiing around the tarmac
00:00:29:00 men in white overalls attend the landed plane
00:00:32:00 greeting the visitor, filmed from a higher vantage point
00:00:43:00 three older women dressed in late 1950s or 1960s style
00:00:52:00 the visitor in fur trimmed coat, upturned hat, carrying gloves and a 1950s style beauty case (cosmetic case)
00:01:07:00 the women come out of the house, pretend to be running away, waving at the camera and hop into a car
00:01:27:00 the hostess poses in her garden with a lovely pink flower
00:01:44:00 reversing the Holden model car down the driveway with a lemon tree over the fence in the background
